meanings.definition: To form or cause to form a group or cluster
meanings.sent1: The stars constellated beautifully in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The toys were constellated neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The cookies constellated on the plate, ready to be eaten.
meanings.sent4: The students constellated around the teacher, eager to learn.
meanings.sent5: The flowers constellated in the garden, creating a colorful display.

meanings.definition: To be arranged in or as if in a constellation
meanings.sent1: The lights constellated on the Christmas tree, shining brightly.
meanings.sent2: The buildings constellated along the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The balloons constellated in the room, adding a festive touch.
meanings.sent4: The candles constellated on the birthday cake, ready to be lit.
meanings.sent5: The boats constellated on the lake, reflecting in the water.
